explanation:
code_hardening: Used try-with-resources to ensure each InputStream is properly closed, added generic Enumeration<URL>, introduced final for local variables like URL, InputStream, Attributes, and strings, and guarded against null InputStream.
resolve_compilation_errors: Updated the method to private void logVersionInfo() to match the caller in run(), removed all return statements, and used the existing instance-level java.util.logging.Logger field already present in the class instead of returning values.
exception_handling: Preserved silent exception handling semantics by catching IOException around resource enumeration and a broad Exception around per-manifest processing, while consolidating logic into fewer, clearer try/catch blocks.
logic_customization: Iterated through all MANIFEST.MF resources without early exit, checked each manifest for a non-null Implementation-Version, and logged an INFO message including both the manifest URL and version string instead of returning a value.
refactoring: Renamed the method to reflect logging behavior, improved variable names for clarity (e.g., manifestResources, manifestUrl), and simplified control flow within a single cohesive method.
misc: Logged at INFO level using java.util.logging.Logger with parameterized messages and applied minor formatting consistent with the surrounding code; no new custom APIs were introduced.
